nodes.name: System
nodes.description: An integrated collection of components working together to achieve specific objectives. The fundamental organizing unit of enterprise architecture.

nodes.name: Architecture
nodes.description: The fundamental organization of a system, including its components, relationships, and principles governing design and evolution.

nodes.name: Infrastructure
nodes.description: The foundational computing resources and services that support application deployment and operation.

nodes.name: Component
nodes.description: A modular, reusable unit of software that encapsulates specific functionality and can be independently deployed.

nodes.name: Module
nodes.description: A self-contained unit of code that groups related functionality and maintains clear boundaries with other modules.

nodes.name: Service
nodes.description: A discrete unit of functionality accessible over a network, typically following service-oriented or microservices patterns.

nodes.name: API
nodes.description: Application Programming Interface that defines contracts for software component interaction and data exchange.

nodes.name: Interface
nodes.description: A defined boundary that specifies how components communicate, including methods, parameters, and contracts.

nodes.name: Protocol
nodes.description: A standardized set of rules and conventions for communication between systems or components.

nodes.name: Framework
nodes.description: A reusable software structure that provides generic functionality and can be extended for application-specific features.

nodes.name: Platform
nodes.description: An integrated environment providing foundational services, tools, and runtime for application development and deployment.

nodes.name: Integration
nodes.description: The process of combining separate systems or components to function as a coordinated whole.

nodes.name: Deployment
nodes.description: The process of delivering and installing software to target environments for execution.

nodes.name: Configuration
nodes.description: The set of parameters and settings that define system behavior and operational characteristics.

nodes.name: Environment
nodes.description: A specific configuration of infrastructure, services, and settings where applications execute.

nodes.name: Security
nodes.description: The practice of protecting systems, data, and resources from unauthorized access, modification, or destruction.

nodes.name: Authentication
nodes.description: The process of verifying the identity of users, systems, or processes attempting to access resources.

nodes.name: Authorization
nodes.description: The process of determining what actions an authenticated entity is permitted to perform.

nodes.name: Encryption
nodes.description: The process of encoding information to prevent unauthorized access, ensuring confidentiality and integrity.

nodes.name: Access
nodes.description: The ability to interact with resources, systems, or data, controlled through authentication and authorization mechanisms.

nodes.name: Permission
nodes.description: Specific rights granted to users or systems to perform operations on resources.

nodes.name: Credential
nodes.description: Information used to authenticate identity, such as passwords, certificates, or cryptographic keys.

nodes.name: Token
nodes.description: A digital artifact representing authentication state or authorization claims, used for secure communication.

nodes.name: Audit
nodes.description: The systematic recording and review of system activities for security, compliance, and accountability purposes.

nodes.name: Compliance
nodes.description: Adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and organizational policies.

nodes.name: Vulnerability
nodes.description: A weakness in system design, implementation, or operation that could be exploited to compromise security.

nodes.name: Threat
nodes.description: A potential danger that could exploit vulnerabilities to cause harm to systems, data, or operations.

nodes.name: Data
nodes.description: Structured or unstructured information that is collected, stored, processed, and analyzed within systems.

nodes.name: Memory
nodes.description: The capability to store and retrieve information, encompassing both volatile and persistent storage mechanisms.

nodes.name: Storage
nodes.description: Physical or logical systems for persisting data, including databases, file systems, and cloud storage.

nodes.name: Database
nodes.description: An organized collection of structured data with mechanisms for efficient storage, retrieval, and management.

nodes.name: Cache
nodes.description: A high-speed data storage layer that stores frequently accessed information for rapid retrieval.

nodes.name: Index
nodes.description: A data structure that improves the speed of data retrieval operations by maintaining organized references.

nodes.name: Query
nodes.description: A request for data or information from a database or information system, typically using structured query languages.

nodes.name: Record
nodes.description: A single complete unit of related data fields representing an entity instance in a database or collection.

nodes.name: Schema
nodes.description: The formal structure defining how data is organized, including tables, fields, relationships, and constraints.

nodes.name: Model
nodes.description: An abstract representation of data structures, business entities, or system components and their relationships.

nodes.name: Entity
nodes.description: A distinguishable object or concept with independent existence, represented as a data structure in systems.

nodes.name: Relationship
nodes.description: A logical connection between entities or data elements that defines how they interact or relate to each other.

nodes.name: Persistence
nodes.description: The characteristic of data that outlives the process that created it, maintained through storage mechanisms.

nodes.name: Retrieval
nodes.description: The process of accessing and extracting stored information based on queries or specified criteria.

nodes.name: Backup
nodes.description: A copy of data created to enable recovery in case of data loss, corruption, or disaster.

nodes.name: Logic
nodes.description: The systematic principles and rules governing reasoning, decision-making, and problem-solving within systems.

nodes.name: Reasoning
nodes.description: The cognitive process of drawing conclusions, making inferences, and solving problems based on available information.

nodes.name: Decision
nodes.description: The process of selecting an action or conclusion from multiple alternatives based on criteria and constraints.

nodes.name: Analysis
nodes.description: The systematic examination and evaluation of data, systems, or processes to extract insights and inform decisions.

nodes.name: Inference
nodes.description: The process of deriving logical conclusions from premises or evidence using reasoning mechanisms.

nodes.name: Pattern
nodes.description: A recurring arrangement, design, or template that provides reusable solutions to common problems.

nodes.name: Rule
nodes.description: A formal specification of conditions and actions that govern system behavior and decision-making.

nodes.name: Condition
nodes.description: A logical expression or state that must be satisfied for specific actions or outcomes to occur.

nodes.name: Evaluation
nodes.description: The process of assessing and determining the value, quality, or significance of data, expressions, or outcomes.

nodes.name: Validation
nodes.description: The process of verifying that data, inputs, or outputs meet specified requirements and constraints.

nodes.name: Classification
nodes.description: The systematic categorization of entities or data into predefined classes based on characteristics or rules.

nodes.name: Prediction
nodes.description: The process of forecasting future outcomes or behaviors based on historical data and patterns.

nodes.name: Communication
nodes.description: The exchange of information, messages, or data between systems, components, or users through defined channels.

nodes.name: Message
nodes.description: A discrete unit of communication containing data or instructions transmitted between components or systems.

nodes.name: Request
nodes.description: A message sent to solicit information, resources, or actions from a service or system component.

nodes.name: Response
nodes.description: A message returned in reply to a request, containing results, status information, or requested data.

nodes.name: Event
nodes.description: A significant occurrence or state change in a system that may trigger actions or notifications.

nodes.name: Notification
nodes.description: An alert or message sent to inform users or systems about events, state changes, or important information.

nodes.name: Channel
nodes.description: A dedicated path or medium for transmitting messages or data between communicating parties.

nodes.name: Stream
nodes.description: A continuous flow of data or events processed sequentially, often in real-time or near-real-time.

nodes.name: Queue
nodes.description: A data structure that holds messages or tasks in order for sequential processing, enabling asynchronous communication.

nodes.name: Broadcast
nodes.description: The transmission of messages or data to multiple recipients simultaneously.

nodes.name: Identity
nodes.description: The unique characteristics and attributes that distinguish an entity, user, or system from others.

nodes.name: User
nodes.description: An individual or system entity that interacts with applications, services, or systems.

nodes.name: Session
nodes.description: A temporary period of interaction between a user or system and an application, maintaining state and context.

nodes.name: Context
nodes.description: The circumstances, environment, or state information relevant to the current execution or interaction.

nodes.name: Profile
nodes.description: A collection of attributes, preferences, and settings associated with a user or system entity.

nodes.name: Preference
nodes.description: User-specific choices and settings that customize behavior, appearance, or functionality.

nodes.name: Setting
nodes.description: Configurable parameters that control system or application behavior and characteristics.

nodes.name: State
nodes.description: The current condition, values, or configuration of a system, component, or process at a specific point in time.

nodes.name: History
nodes.description: A chronological record of past events, actions, or changes within a system or for an entity.

nodes.name: Scope
nodes.description: The extent or boundaries of visibility, access, or applicability for variables, permissions, or operations.

nodes.name: Tenant
nodes.description: A distinct customer or organizational entity in a multi-tenant system, with isolated data and configuration.

nodes.name: Organization
nodes.description: A structured entity representing a business, group, or institution with associated users, resources, and policies.

nodes.name: Operation
nodes.description: A discrete action, function, or procedure performed by a system to accomplish specific objectives.

nodes.name: Process
nodes.description: A series of coordinated actions or steps executed to transform inputs into outputs or achieve specific goals.

nodes.name: Task
nodes.description: A discrete unit of work to be completed, often part of a larger process or workflow.

nodes.name: Job
nodes.description: A scheduled or queued unit of work, typically executed asynchronously or in batch mode.

nodes.name: Workflow
nodes.description: An orchestrated sequence of tasks, processes, or activities that accomplish a business objective.

nodes.name: Pipeline
nodes.description: A series of processing stages where output from one stage becomes input for the next.

nodes.name: Schedule
nodes.description: The planned timing and sequencing of tasks, jobs, or operations to occur at specific times or intervals.

nodes.name: Trigger
nodes.description: A condition or event that initiates the execution of a process, workflow, or action.

nodes.name: Monitor
nodes.description: The continuous observation and tracking of system behavior, performance, and health metrics.

nodes.name: Health
nodes.description: The operational status and wellness of systems, services, or components indicating their ability to function.

nodes.name: Status
nodes.description: The current state or condition of an operation, process, or system component at a point in time.

nodes.name: Metric
nodes.description: A quantifiable measurement used to track, assess, and compare system performance or business outcomes.

nodes.name: Quality
nodes.description: The degree to which a system, product, or service meets requirements and satisfies user expectations.

nodes.name: Performance
nodes.description: The measurement of how efficiently and effectively a system executes its functions under specific conditions.

nodes.name: Reliability
nodes.description: The ability of a system to consistently perform its intended functions without failure over time.

nodes.name: Availability
nodes.description: The degree to which a system is operational and accessible when required for use.

nodes.name: Scalability
nodes.description: The capacity of a system to handle increased load or expand to accommodate growth without performance degradation.

nodes.name: Efficiency
nodes.description: The optimal use of resources to achieve desired outcomes with minimal waste or overhead.

nodes.name: Optimization
nodes.description: The process of improving system performance, efficiency, or resource utilization through refinement and tuning.

nodes.name: Benchmark
nodes.description: A standard or reference point used to measure and compare system performance or quality metrics.

nodes.name: Test
nodes.description: The process of evaluating system functionality, performance, and quality to identify defects or verify requirements.

nodes.name: Quality Validation
nodes.description: The verification that products or systems meet specified quality standards and requirements.

nodes.name: Collaboration
nodes.description: The cooperative effort of multiple individuals or teams working together toward shared objectives.

nodes.name: Team
nodes.description: A group of individuals working together with complementary skills toward common goals.

nodes.name: Role
nodes.description: A defined set of responsibilities, permissions, and functions assigned to users or team members.

nodes.name: Collaboration Permission
nodes.description: Access rights governing what users can view, edit, or share within collaborative environments.

nodes.name: Share
nodes.description: The action of making resources, documents, or information accessible to other users or teams.

nodes.name: Review
nodes.description: The systematic examination and evaluation of work, code, or documents by peers or stakeholders.

nodes.name: Approval
nodes.description: The formal authorization or acceptance of changes, decisions, or deliverables before proceeding.

nodes.name: Comment
nodes.description: Annotations, notes, or feedback attached to documents, code, or discussions for communication purposes.

nodes.name: Feedback
nodes.description: Information or opinions provided about work, performance, or deliverables to guide improvement.

nodes.name: Version
nodes.description: A specific iteration or release of a document, code, or system identifying its state at a point in time.

nodes.name: Knowledge
nodes.description: Information, expertise, and understanding accumulated and organized for use in decision-making and problem-solving.

nodes.name: Concept
nodes.description: An abstract idea, principle, or mental construct that represents fundamental understanding within a domain.

nodes.name: Definition
nodes.description: A precise statement explaining the meaning, scope, or nature of a term, concept, or entity.

nodes.name: Documentation
nodes.description: Written materials that describe systems, processes, code, or functionality for understanding and reference.

nodes.name: Reference
nodes.description: Information sources or materials consulted for facts, guidance, or authoritative knowledge.

nodes.name: Guide
nodes.description: Instructional materials that provide step-by-step directions or best practices for accomplishing tasks.

nodes.name: Tutorial
nodes.description: Educational content designed to teach specific skills, concepts, or processes through guided instruction.

nodes.name: Example
nodes.description: Illustrative instances or samples that demonstrate concepts, usage, or implementation patterns.

nodes.name: Template
nodes.description: Reusable patterns or structures that provide a starting point for creating similar documents, code, or solutions.

nodes.name: Best Practice
nodes.description: Proven methods, techniques, or approaches that have been demonstrated to produce superior results.
